intro: Cyclanthera entata, commonly known as the African horned melon, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant produces large, spiny fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a distinctive waxy coating. The fruit is edible, though it has a strong, musky flavor and a tough, fibrous texture.
